intro: Crambe gordjagini, commonly known as the mountain crambe, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many economically important crops such as mustard and cabbage. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30 to 60 centimeters, featuring lance-shaped leaves and small, yellowish flowers arranged in racemes. Its seeds are encased in a hard, pod-like structure, which is characteristic of the Brassicaceae family. Crambe gordjagini is adapted to harsh, alpine environments, showing resilience to cold and poor soil conditions.
